title: Ensuring the Future Is Made in All of America by All of America's Workers

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs the federal government to prioritize buying goods, products, and services made in the United States to support American workers and businesses. It establishes a centralized office to oversee waivers to domestic purchasing rules, increases transparency of procurement decisions, and updates regulations to strengthen 'Made in America' requirements.
potential_concerns: Stricter domestic purchasing requirements may increase costs for federal agencies and delay procurement processes.
Centralizing waiver approvals could create bureaucratic bottlenecks or slow responses to urgent procurement needs.
Higher domestic content standards might limit flexibility to source specialized materials or technology internationally.
Smaller or less competitive American suppliers may struggle to meet the new standards without adequate support.
Transparency requirements could expose sensitive information or create risks if not carefully balanced with national security concerns.
